overview.heading: Biocides in paints
overview.text: In the 21st century, coatings mainly fulfill functional properties for products in addition to pure coloring. Coatings protect computer chips from short circuits, ensure hygiene on surfaces in the medical sector, or increase the service life of objects through corrosion protection.

sustainability.heading: Sustainability in the paints industry
sustainability.text: The sustainability trend is demanding many new requirements in the paint industry as well, especially in the area of interior wall dispersion paints and paints for children's toys. Directives and legal regulations are increasingly limiting or eliminating raw materials. This affects so-called VOC (organic solvents) contents, preservatives and substances such as isocyanates, which are used to harden some paints.

solution.heading: It's time to rethink
solution.text: At Evopack, we offer solutions for the paint and coatings industry that help ensure product integrity down to the last drop. This means that none or the least possible amount of toxic substances are used in the production process.

children.heading: Sustainability in the paints industry

Ein Klarlack besteht aus bis zu 99 %, Beton für Hochhäuser aus bis zu 10 % und Klebstoffe aus beihnahe 100 % Bindemitteldispersion. In den meisten Fällen werden Bindemitteldispersionen in der Industrie zu anderen Produkten weiter-verarbeitet, bevor sie an den Endkonsumenten gelangen. Dies erfordert maximale Performance: zuverlässig und langfristig.

applicationAreas.subheading: Binder dispersions are the base materials for paints, adhesives, construction chemicals and much more.

overview.heading: Use of Binder dispersions
overview.text: They form the basis of many formulations and are used in high volumes. A clear coat consists of up to 99 %, concrete for high-rise buildings of up to 10 % and adhesives of almost 100 % binder dispersions. In most cases, binder dispersions are further processed in the industry into other products before they reach the end consumer. This demands maximum performance: reliable and long-term.

sustainability.heading: Sustainability in the binder industry
sustainability.text: In recent years, more and more precursors and end products have been subject to stringent regulations regarding human safety and ecological impact. This primarily concerns preservatives, such as biocides. In some cases, the EU is enforcing the use of lower quantities or the elimination of biocides by regulatory means. The binder industry is usually the first link in the chain and can strongly influence the quantities of preservatives used. As a binder manufacturer, you should use as few preservatives as possible to allow maximum leeway for your customers.

solution.text: At Evopack, we offer solutions for the binder industry that help ensure product integrity down to the last drop. This means that none or the least possible amount of toxic substances are used in the production process.
